title: Aluminum Prices Surging: Bull Run Amid Supply Crunches
summary: Global aluminum prices have surged to a five-month high due to economic growth, supply concerns, and the impact of China's policy changes. Analysts predict further price increases driven by supply crunches from major bauxite exporters and China's efforts to cap domestic production.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 6-Month High as Supply Concerns Grow
summary: Aluminum prices reached their highest level since early 2025 amid fears of supply deficits as China nears its 45-million-ton output cap. Despite subdued demand in the US and tariff pressures, long-term deficit concerns support a bullish outlook, although near-term price direction remains uncertain.

title: Aluminum Rises to Over 3-Year High
summary: UK aluminum futures rose above $2,900 per tonne in October, marking the highest price in over three years. This increase is driven by tight near-term supply and strong long-term demand, with China emphasizing prevention of overcapacity in metal production.

title: SMM: October's product-wise aluminium processing PMI mostly dropped below 50 mark
summary: In October, aluminum processing PMI mostly fell below 50, indicating contraction in production activity. High aluminum prices increased costs and squeezed profits, while end-use demand remains weak, suggesting continued pressure on the industry unless prices or demand improve.

title: SMM: October's product-wise aluminium processing PMI mostly dropped below 50 mark
summary: In October 2025, the aluminium processing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) mostly fell below the 50 mark, indicating contraction. High aluminium prices increased costs, squeezing profits and inhibiting production. The sector awaits improvement in end-user demand and aluminium price trends to relieve pressure.

title: Not Only Tariffs on Trucks: Trump Administration's Proclamation Amends the Tariff Landscape on Automobiles, Steel and Aluminum
summary: Starting November 1, 2025, new tariffs take effect including a 25% reduction in steel and aluminum tariffs for USMCA-qualifying producers in Canada and Mexico that support new U.S. production capacity. This move aims to foster a domestic ecosystem in steel, aluminum, automobile, and medium- and heavy-duty vehicle sectors.

title: November 1 Tariff Increase for Heavy- and Medium-Duty Trucks and Buses
summary: Effective November 1, 2025, tariffs increase to 25% on medium- and heavy-duty trucks and parts, and 10% on buses. The tariffs are part of a Section 232 investigation and affect imports from Canada and Mexico, with preferential treatment under USMCA limited to non-U.S. content. This impacts production and supply chains in North America.

title: US truck tariff to come into effect on November 1, Trump confirms
summary: A 25% Section 232 tariff on heavy truck imports to the US will be implemented starting November 1, 2025, delayed from October 1. The tariff is expected to disrupt heavy truck production networks and increase truck prices, potentially reducing truck buying and manufacturing in the US and Mexico.

title: COIL: A CHALLENGING FIRST HALF OF 2025, WITH A RECOVERY PLAN UNDERWAY
summary: COIL, a world leader in aluminium anodising, reported a challenging first half of 2025 but has a recovery plan underway. The company highlights efforts to navigate market difficulties and improve operational performance amid industry headwinds.

title: Fully optimised for sustainability
summary: BMW Group's light metal foundry in Landshut has been recertified by the Aluminium Stewardship Initiative (ASI) for its sustainable use of aluminium. Over a third of its annual aluminium needs are met with solar aluminium, and nearly two-thirds come from recycled sources.

title: When going green becomes the new profit curve for aluminium. Or ...
summary: The aluminium industry faces a critical juncture as demand is projected to rise by 80% by 2050, but it remains a major emitter. Producers must invest in green technologies now to remain competitive and avoid regulatory and market penalties.

title: European Green Aluminium Summit 2025 to Tackle Sustainability and Policy Challenges
summary: The 3rd European Green Aluminium Summit will be held in Düsseldorf, Germany, on November 11–12, 2025, focusing on green aluminium production, recycling, and circular economy strategies. The event will address EU climate policies and innovations in low-carbon aluminium technologies.

title: The 3rd European Green Aluminium Summit 2025
summary: This summit will explore aluminium's role in Europe's green transition, highlighting technological innovations, regulatory impacts, and sustainability practices. It will feature discussions on low-carbon production, recycling, and EU climate legislation.

title: Brazilian Aluminium Can Summit 2025 brings together global leaders to discuss the future of the aluminium can industry
summary: The Brazilian Aluminium Can Summit 2025 will gather industry leaders to discuss innovation, decarbonization, and the circular economy in the aluminium can sector. The event will highlight sustainability and competitiveness in the global aluminium packaging industry.

title: Aluminum Parts Trends 2025: Innovation & Sustainability
summary: The aluminium parts market is growing, driven by demand in automotive, construction, and packaging sectors. Emphasis on recycled aluminium and low-carbon production is becoming a competitive advantage for businesses.

title: First brake caliper made from 100% recycled aluminium sets a benchmark in sustainability
summary: Brembo has introduced the first brake caliper made entirely from recycled aluminium, reducing CO₂ emissions by 70% over its lifecycle without compromising performance. This innovation highlights the potential for sustainable materials in automotive components.

title: Ferrous pricing remains on narrow path
summary: U.S. steel production increased by 2.2% through September 2025 compared to 2024, with 66.7 million tons produced. Ferrous scrap prices stayed in a narrow range from mid-April to mid-September, with some volatility in September causing a price decline. Demand for recycled steel is stable to rising, supported by increased crude steel production and mill capacity utilization.

title: Gerdau Reports Strong US Steel Demand Growth in 4Q
summary: Gerdau's North American steel operations saw an 11% revenue increase in Q3 2025, driven by strong U.S. market demand. Crude steel production rose 11.6% year-over-year, with sales volumes also increasing. The extended order backlog of 70 days, above the historical average, indicates sustained demand momentum into early 2026, fueled by infrastructure and renewable energy projects.

title: Nucor raises prices for thick-gauge rolled steel by $60/t starting in November
summary: Nucor announced a price increase of $60 per ton for thick-gauge rolled steel products starting November 2025. The new theoretical price for standard thickness A36 base rolled products is estimated at around $1,335 per ton, reflecting market adjustments amid ongoing demand dynamics.

title: Steel prices fall slightly amid mixed market signals
summary: Steel prices in China fell to 3,067 CNY/ton on October 31, 2025, down 0.68% from the previous day, continuing a slight downward trend over the past month. Prices are down 6.2% compared to the same time last year, with forecasts suggesting a moderate decline over the next 12 months due to market uncertainties.

title: Metal Price News - Forecast 2025
summary: Stainless steel demand remains low, with China expanding production despite slow markets. Scrap prices are stable but low due to weak stainless steel demand. Long-term scrap demand is expected to rise with the green transition, although supply constraints may emerge. Nickel prices spiked earlier in the year but have stabilized, with supply currently exceeding demand.

title: China's steel production will fall below 1 billion tonnes in 2025, but the industry imbalance persists
summary: China's crude steel production is expected to drop below 1 billion tonnes in 2025, continuing government efforts to reduce output and restructure the sector. Despite the production cut, a supply-demand imbalance remains due to a prolonged downturn in the steel-intensive real estate market and a surge in exports of lower-value steel billets. The steel industry faces challenges including rising material costs and the need for significant investment to meet carbon neutrality goals by 2060.

title: Gerdau Reports Strong US Steel Demand Growth in 4Q
summary: Brazil-based steelmaker Gerdau reported an 11% revenue growth in North America driven by surging US steel demand in Q4 2025, fueled by infrastructure investments and renewable energy projects. Crude steel production increased 11.6% year-over-year to 1.35 million metric tonnes, with sales volumes also rising. The extended order backlog indicates sustained demand momentum into early 2026.

title: Brazilian Steel Market Faces Import Competition Stalling Prices
summary: Brazil's steel industry is under pressure from high import competition, which is stalling domestic steel price increases despite attempts to raise prices. Several Brazilian steel plants are operating at losses due to margin compression and ongoing import challenges. An antidumping investigation is underway but will extend uncertainty until late 2026, threatening the sustainability of local production.

title: Saudi Arabia: Hadeed Announces Steel Prices for November
summary: The Saudi Iron and Steel Company (Hadeed) announced increased prices for long steel products, including rebar (12–32 mm), for November 2025. This reflects adjustments in the regional steel market pricing.

title: Steel Production Carbon Cuts: Actionable Path
summary: A new study published in Nature by UCL researchers presents cost-effective strategies to reduce carbon emissions from global iron and steel plants. Retrofitting aging plants could cut 22.4 billion tonnes of CO₂ by 2050 at a moderate cost, balancing emissions reduction with economic feasibility. The steel industry accounts for 7% of global carbon emissions, and decarbonization efforts are critical given its fossil fuel reliance.

title: Personnel changes on the Executive Board of thyssenkrupp Steel
summary: Thyssenkrupp Steel announced executive board changes effective November 1, 2025, including Wilfried von Rath taking on additional HR responsibilities and Marie Jaroni assuming interim responsibility for production operations and strategic management. These changes aim to strengthen leadership as the company navigates future challenges in steel production.

title: China Steel Industry Summit for 2026 Market
summary: The China Steel Industry Summit for the 2026 market took place in Nanjing, China, gathering industry leaders to discuss market outlooks and strategies. The event focused on addressing production trends, capacity management, and market challenges ahead.

title: Green steel revolution: navigating a new frontier in 2025
summary: Sweden is expected to produce the world's first truly zero-carbon emission steel in 2025, marking a historic milestone for the steel industry. This breakthrough will reshape pricing, markets, and supply chains, with hydrogen-based direct reduction iron (DRI) and electric arc furnace (EAF) technologies leading the green transition. However, challenges include high energy costs, limited green hydrogen availability, and regulatory pressures like the EU’s Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM).

title: Steel Production Carbon Cuts: Actionable Path
summary: Emerging cleaner technologies such as scrap recycling, carbon capture, hydrogen, bioenergy, and direct electrorefining offer promising pathways to reduce emissions in steel production. Researchers emphasize that no single technology fits all plants; regional and plant-specific strategies are essential. Strong government policies and financial support are critical to enable widespread adoption of these decarbonization technologies.

title: Hitachi Energy unveils innovations for a sustainable energy future at CIIE 2025
summary: Hitachi Energy showcased innovations to improve grid reliability and support green hydrogen production, collaborating with major steel enterprises. Their eco-efficient gas-insulated switchgear (GIS) technology reduces reliance on SF₆, a potent greenhouse gas, aiding grid decarbonization. These advancements contribute to sustainable steel production by enhancing energy infrastructure and supporting green technologies.

title: Copper Prices Surge on US-China Deal Optimism, Tight Supply ...
summary: Copper prices edged closer to record highs driven by optimism over a US-China trade deal and concerns about tightening global supply due to output disruptions. Copper futures on COMEX reached as high as $5.247 per pound, near record levels, supported by easing trade tensions and paused rare earth export controls by China.

title: Copper Declines from 3-Month High
summary: Copper futures in the US fell to $5.09 per pound from a three-month high of $5.17 due to a stronger dollar and uncertain demand outlook, despite ongoing supply concerns. The market reacted to Federal Reserve signals against a rate cut and easing US-China trade barriers, while supply disruptions from major miners and a fatal mudslide in Indonesia impacted supply.

title: Supply Shocks and Solar Shifts Drive Copper Prices Higher
summary: Copper prices increased 3.7% month-over-month due to sharp supply tightening following production losses at Indonesia's Grasberg mine. The disruption highlighted ongoing raw material constraints, pushing premiums at Europe's largest copper smelter to record highs. Despite recent price gains, the global copper market remains well-supplied, which may limit further upside.

title: Tariff Truce & Copper's Repricing Path: How US-China Trade ...
summary: Following the easing of US-China tariffs, copper prices rallied modestly, supported by accelerated importer activity and supply normalization. However, structural supply risks remain, with market repricing dependent on China's industrial recovery and new mine developments. An accident at a major copper mine in September 2025 further spiked prices, showing sensitivity to supply disruptions.

title: Copper Prices Higher Ahead of Trump-Xi Meeting
summary: Copper prices rose on optimism about a US-China trade deal, with LME copper up 0.6% at $11,026 per ton. China's industrial profits grew at their fastest pace in nearly two years in September, supporting demand sentiment. However, the Yangshan copper premium shrank, indicating that purchases have yet to accelerate significantly.

title: $10000 Copper Prices Expected to Become the 'New Normal'
summary: UBS predicts that average copper prices on the London Metal Exchange will reach between $10,500 and $11,000 per ton in 2025, signaling a new normal for copper pricing driven by sustained demand and supply dynamics.

title: Copper breakout above $11,000 to be short-lived, Goldman Sachs says
summary: Copper prices briefly surpassed $11,200 per ton, breaking previous records amid supply concerns. However, Goldman Sachs cautions that this breakout may be short-lived due to underlying demand weakness and potential market corrections.

title: Ivanhoe Mines Issues 2025 Third-Quarter Financial Results and Overview of Construction and Exploration Activities
summary: Ivanhoe Mines reported that during Q3 2025, their Kamoa-Kakula copper complex milled 3.46 million tonnes of ore, producing 71,226 tonnes of copper. Year-to-date copper production reached 316,393 tonnes, with 2025 guidance maintained at 370,000 to 420,000 tonnes. The Phase 3 concentrator operated at 30% above design capacity, and dewatering of the Kakula Mine is progressing, with higher-grade mining expected from November.

title: Glencore 9-month Own-sourced Copper Production Down - Nasdaq
summary: Glencore reported a 17% decline in own-sourced copper production for the first nine months of 2025, totaling 583,500 tonnes, due to lower head grades and recoveries from planned mine sequencing. The company revised its full-year copper production guidance to 850,000 to 875,000 tonnes, down from the previous 850,000 to 890,000 tonnes range.

title: Capstone Copper Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Capstone Copper's sulphide copper production in Q3 2025 was 44,904 tonnes at a C1 cash cost of $2.00/lb, a significant improvement from Q3 2024. However, Pinto Valley Mine's copper production was 29% lower due to mine sequencing and drought-related water constraints affecting mill throughput. The mine resumed full mill operations in October 2025.

title: Indonesian Nickel Ore Benchmark Prices (HPM) on November 1 Decreased
summary: The benchmark price for 1.6% grade nickel ore in Indonesia fell to 26.65 USD/WMT on November 1, down from the previous period. Prices for higher grades also declined, reflecting continued downward pressure in the nickel ore market.

title: Nickel Price Update: Q3 2025 in Review
summary: Nickel prices remained volatile in 2025 due to oversupply, mainly driven by rapid production growth in Indonesia. LME nickel stockpiles continued to rise, reaching 231,504 MT by the end of Q3, while demand growth was not enough to offset the surplus.

title: [SMM Analysis] Nickel Prices Pulled Back This Week Due to Fundamentals
summary: Nickel prices declined this week in both futures and spot markets, with SHFE and LME contracts showing synchronized weakness. The market is experiencing cost support at the bottom but faces pressure from high inventories.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel futures fell to a one-month low below $15,100 per tonne, driven by oversupply from Indonesia. LME inventories reached a record high, and Indonesian production quotas have been tightened to stabilize prices.

title: Fitch's BMI Reports Predict Nickel Prices to Gradually Rebound
summary: Fitch's BMI forecasts nickel prices to gradually recover from 2025 to 2028, with average prices expected between $18,500 and $21,500 per ton. The global market is expected to remain in surplus, but prices may stabilize as demand grows.

title: Vale Posts Net Profit Beat, Cuts Cost Outlook for Copper, Nickel
summary: Vale reported a net profit beat and lowered its all-in nickel production cost outlook to $13,000–$14,000 per ton, reflecting improved efficiency and cost management in its nickel operations.

title: Adhi Kartiko nine-month profit soars on stronger nickel sales
summary: PT Adhi Kartiko Pratama Tbk, an IDX-listed nickel mining firm, reported a significant increase in its nine-month profit, attributed to stronger nickel sales. The article is paywalled, so further details on production or capacity are not available.

title: Vale posts net profit beat, cuts cost outlook for copper, nickel
summary: Vale, a major global miner, reported better-than-expected net profits and announced a reduction in its cost outlook for both copper and nickel operations. The article does not provide specific details on nickel production or capacity changes.

title: Why Nickel is Set to Skyrocket: The EV and Renewable Energy Revolution
summary: Nickel is becoming a cornerstone in the shift towards sustainable energy, especially in electric vehicle (EV) batteries and renewable energy storage systems. Companies like PT. Anugrah Neo Energy Materials are producing advanced nickel materials aligned with environmental, social, and governance (ESG) standards to support the growing demand for battery-grade nickel in EVs and grid storage.

title: Pioneering the Future of Sustainable Nickel: TGEM and BGM's Strategic Joint Venture in the US and Albania
summary: TGEM and BGM have signed a memorandum of understanding to develop sustainable Class 1 Nickel supply chains critical for the US and European EV markets. The joint venture will establish processing facilities using TGEM’s STAL Technology to produce Mixed Hydroxide Precipitate (MHP) for battery supply chains, emphasizing sustainable practices and innovation in nickel production.

title: Indonesia's Nickel Mining for EV Boom Threatens Environment
summary: Indonesia, the world’s top nickel producer, faces environmental challenges as its nickel mining expands rapidly to meet EV battery demand. While nickel is crucial for the clean energy transition, mining activities threaten biodiversity and ecosystems, raising concerns about balancing economic benefits with environmental sustainability.

title: Ambatovy Nickel Project Weathers Madagascar's Political Upheaval
summary: The Ambatovy nickel project in Madagascar has maintained operational stability despite political turmoil, ensuring uninterrupted supply of battery-grade nickel. This stability is critical for global EV manufacturers relying on consistent nickel availability, highlighting the importance of diversified and reliable nickel sources amid regional supply uncertainties.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali acquisition by Mannesmann Stainless Tubes is complete
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has completed the acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes GmbH from Salzgitter AG, expanding its seamless stainless steel and nickel alloy tube production. The acquired company will be renamed DMV and integrated into Cogne’s group to enhance competitiveness in the global market.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne finalizes Mannesmann tubes acquisition to expand stainless footprint
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has finalized its €135 million acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes, broadening its presence in the seamless stainless steel and nickel alloy pipe market. The European Commission cleared the merger in June, and the acquired operations will be rebranded as DMV.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris reduced pipe sales to 2.95 million tons in January-September
summary: Tenaris, the international pipe company, reported a 2% decrease in pipe sales for January-September 2025, totaling 2.95 million tons compared to the same period last year. The decline reflects ongoing market adjustments in the steel and pipe industry.

title: FTSE MIB Hits Three-Week High
summary: Tenaris shares rose 4.8% in Italy, contributing to the FTSE MIB's three-week high, as strong corporate earnings and positive market sentiment boosted heavyweight stocks. The index is on track for its fourth monthly advance, with financials and industrials leading gains.
